p: Human metapneumovirus (hMPV) is a worldwide distributed enveloped virus with a RNA genome closely related to respiratory syncytial virus. hMPV belongs to the Paramyxoviridae family, in the genus Metapneumovirus, first identified in the Netherlands in 2001 [ 1]. Based on genetic and antigenic variability, hMPV strains have been classified in two groups or lineages (A and B) and four sublineages (A1, A2, B1 and B2) [ 1– 3]. The virus has been reported as a common respiratory pathogen in childhood, associated mainly with upper but also with lower respiratory tract infections [ 2, 4]. During the annual epidemics, hMPV has been associated with a significant number of hospital admissions in young children [ 4– 7].
